title: Noxian Soldier in Marrowmark Market
body:
So looking through the Map specifically shurima i noticed that there is this lone Noxian Soldier depicted in the art for the Marrowmark Market, at first i didn't think much of it but then it got me thinking... what is he doing there?

Comparing his Armor to the Art we have on Noxus he even seems to be a part of the Trifarian Legion, which is supposedly led by Darius himself, so the Question arises:

What is a Current/Former Member of the Trifarian Legion doing in southern Shurima seemingly on his own?


https://imgur.com/DJP7Oja

ps: Another reason i noticed its abnormal is because the two people on the left in the image look in his direction as if he doesnt belong there

replies.body:
Trifarian Legionaries do not always move as a grouped battlefield unit - as in 'The Principles of Strength', they are often sent as emissaries or enforcers, whose mere presence legitimises a claim from Noxus.

Imagine a city, with a strong military and great defences. Noxus has been trying to annex them, but the city has been turning away their ambassadors and traders for years. A single legionary arrives at the front gate, and just walks right in demanding to see the mayor.

What do you do? If you turn him away, he will be sent back with 10, or 100 more of his comrades. If you have him killed (which is absolutely possible, because he's "only" a single, armoured warrior) then you have basically just declared war on Noxus, and you can expect the full force of the empire to be leveled at you in response.

So, the mayor lets him in. He says "This place now belongs to Noxus. I have conquered you in the name of the Trifarix. Here is a plan for how we will transition your governance to the empire."

What do you do now? I can't think of any option but to agree, and try to make the best of this new situation... :-P

So yes, people might often look at members of the Trifarian Legion like they don't belong... but if you're going to give them grief, you'd better be strong enough to stand against the ACTUAL full might of Noxus.

If only Shurima had some sort of huge, powerful military force... and an emperor with the will and strength to stand against Noxus...

Oh, wait.

Actually, on that note, how would Noxus feel about the return of the Ascended? They've been trying for some time to conquer Shurima, as we see with their occupations in cities like Bel'Zhun, but how might the presence of ancient demigods like Azir and Xerath affect that? Would they really be willing to go up against such powerful entities, or would Noxus seek an alliance of sorts with them?

Noxus as a whole probably doesn't know, or thinks it's just fanciful myth from a people who should know when they've been conquered.

Swain? He's probably a little apprehensive, although I bet he's got a plan in place.

The Black Rose? Now, there's a far more interesting/scary situation...

While on the Topic of Noxian Military Strategies, In what rough Order do the following troops come?

Warmasons (Id assume they are first due to being scouts and creating infrastructure)
Emissaries like Diplomats or such?
The Trifarian Legionaries Ultimatum
Full Force of Noxian Military(if neccesary)

Or are there other steps inbetween/before that that are somewhat important?


Bonus Question:
Especially with regions as far away as the marrowmark market which is also surrounded by a less than hospitable desert, how would noxus know wether the Legionare had simply died on the way there as opposed to being killed by the people there?

Generally, I'd imagine the order to be something like this:

Traders and diplomats - "Hey guys! We're from Noxus. You should join us, it's so awesome being part of the empire!"
Emissaries, or ambassadors - "We notice you've not yet joined the empire. Perhaps we can answer any questions you have?"
Slightly scarier emissaries - "Join Noxus. You don't really have a choice."

Then there's probably a long period of uncertainty, where agents and assassins start scouting the society, figuring out what the problem is, reporting back to the capital etc. There might be some saber-rattling on the borders, aggressive posturing from Noxian warbands, military exercises etc. Noxus starts trading more extensively with neighboring states, flooding the local economy with Noxian money. They start to destabilise social order, burning crops, engaging in propaganda etc.

Then come the legionaries.

I would also assume that warmasons are everywhere.  Before, during, and after, Noxus has its eye on somewhere.  If there's a nation or settlement of any consequence at all - I'd give good odds there's a warmason already embedded.  Maybe 3.
Indeed. And if you are defying Noxus and you see a warmason OPENLY surveying your local rivers, mountain ranges, forests, then it's probably time to relocate... :-P

What if you kill the emissary in silence and deny ever seeing him?  Noxus would look for evidence before attacking? what if they can't prove it? they burn a city down and suddenly find the corpse of their emissary drowned around Noxus border and go "oops sorry my bad"

If the Legion sends a warrior, they would likely give that warrior a deadline. If the warrior doesn't return by then, assume he's dead.

Lot of people saying "Just kill him in secret" - that wouldn't help, really. It's not about reporting the death/imprisonment/whatever. It's the LACK of reporting that would be the issue, taken and used as proof, the pretext to invasion etc.

Also, by that time Noxus would have X number of agents already within the city, reporting back. Don't fear the hulking brute at the gate demanding you kneel and sign this piece of paper - fear the trader who bought up nine houses along the city walls last year. Fear the mayor's wife's new best friend who gets a bit drunk and _indiscrete_ at parties. Fear the jailer's apprentice who spits on the name of Noxus, yet apparently has never been outside the walls of the city.

They're all Noxian agents, and they'd be happy to testify to the fact that a legionary arrived, gave his message, then went missing.

And if your response to these hypotheticals is "Well, don't trust anyone in your city who you don't personally know"... then Noxus is already halfway to victory.
